Subject: RE: Maxwell Link 
CAUTION - EXTERNAL: 
Joe, Ed, here's what we're ready to post, unless you have any correction: 
November 
29, 2021 
Victim Attendance at Trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell 
In orders dated October 14 and November 24, 2021, the S.D.N:Y. Court outlined procedures for public access to the trial in 
this matter. (Trial began on November 29, 2021, with jury selection.) Specifically, consistent with the District's COVID-19 
protocols, the Court will ensure public access (with COVID-19 distancing) to the trial in the courtroom itself and in 
several overflow rooms at the courthouse with live feeds of the proceedings. Beyond the live feeds within the 
courthouse, the trial will not be further broadcast; nor will there be any telephonic dial-in to the proceedings. Victim 
access will be coordinated by the U.S. Attorney's Office Victim-Witness Coordinator, 
, and Mr. Joseph Pecorino of the Court's District Executive Office a, 
. Victims who wish to attend the trial may contact either one of those persons 
for further 
information. 
EFTA00010943

COVID-19 Protocols. Per the S.D.N.Y. Response to COVID-19, anyone who appears at any S.D.N.Y. courthouse must 
complete a questionnaire on the date of the proceeding prior to entering the courthouse. All visitors must also have their 
temperature taken when they arrive at the courthouse. Only persons who meet the entry requirements established by the 
questionnaire and whose temperatures are below 100.4 degrees will be allowed to enter the courthouse. All visitors must 
wear a mask that covers the person's nose and mouth. Bandannas, gaiters, and masks with valves are not permitted. If a 
person does not have an approved mask, a screener will provide one. Anyone who fails to comply with the COVID-19 
protocols that have been adopted by the Court will be required to leave the courthouse. There are no exceptions. For more 
information, please see https://wwwnysd.uscourts.govicovid-19-coronavirus.
From: Edward Friedland 
Sent: Monday, November 29, 2021 12:01 PM 
To: 
) c>; 
Cc: Joseph Pecorino 
< 
; 
Matthew Rogers 
Subject: FW: Maxwell Link 
This info on your web page is outdated and is causing the public to try and access the Maxwell matter by phone. Can you 
pull down the access number info and update with the latest order which says in-person? 
Edward A. Friedland, Esq. 
District Court Executive 
United States District Court 
Southern District of New York 
From: Joseph Pecorino 
Sent: Monday, November 29, 2021 11:57 AM 
To: Edward Friedland 
Subject: Maxwell Link 
https://www.justice.goviusao-sdny/united-states-v-ghislaine-maxwell 
Joseph Pecorino 
Office of the District Executive 
United Stales District Court

EMAIL

attachments or clicking on links. 
EFTA00010944
